titleproper.value: Guide to the New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance publicity scrapbook <num>MC.77</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-11-19T18:04:38</date>

unittitle.value: New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance publicity scrapbook

abstract.value: The New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance was established in 1900 to provide professional training for students pursuing a career in business. In 1988, the school was renamed the Leonard N. Stern School of Business. The collection contains a scrapbook with printed ephemera produced by the NYU School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance. The materials within the scrapbook promote the various programs and courses offered by the school. Materials date from 1936 to 1938.

p.value: Identification of item, date; New York University School of Commerce Publicity Scrapbook; MC 77; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
The provenance of this collection is unknown. There is no accession record associated with this collection.
2. NYU Stern, "Timeline", accessed November 19, 2018, available online at http://www.stern.nyu.edu/experience-stern/about/history/timeline

The collection contains a scrapbook with flyers, booklets, mailers, and brochures produced by the New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance. The materials within the scrapbook promote the various programs and courses offered by the school. Materials date from 1936 to 1938.

corpname.value: Leonard N. Stern School of Business
